DOC.brief_summary: A prospective study evaluate efficacy classic homeopathic therapy compare maintenance itraconazole therapy without additional exogenous lactobacillus treatment recurrent Candida vaginitis .
DOC.brief_title: Monthly Itraconazole Versus Classic Homeopathy Treatment Recurrent Vulvovaginal Candidiasis ( RVVC )
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : Antimycotics effectively treat sporadic recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis ( RVVC ) . Classic homeopathy ( CH ) also use treat condition . We compare efficacy CH itraconazole reduce frequency RVVC episodes . Design : Single-centre , prospective , randomize . Sample : One-hundred-and-fifty patient history RVVC acute episode VVC . Methods : Women randomise 3 group : itraconazole lactobacillus ( group 1 ) , itraconazole without lactobacillus ( group 2 ) CH ( group 3 ) . Itraconazole treatment acute infection follow 6-months maintenance regimen monthly single-day itraconazole ( 200 mg bid ) . Thereafter , patient follow without treatment 6 month . Women group 1 give additional vaginal lactobacillus six day per month . CH treatment perform 12 month .
DOC.criteria: Patients 18 year , premenopausal Negative pregnancy test Signed informed consent At least 4 Episodes Candidiasis within last year Candida detectable culture Negative Hepatitis HIVSerology No Allergy Itraconazole Under 18 year
